intro: Melandrium mandonii, commonly known as the Armenian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Melandrium mandonii is adapted to rocky and dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
